title: TIC-TAC-TOE
description: Tic Tac Toe - the classic game of strategy and quick thinking. Can you outsmart your opponent and get three in a row?
fun-fact:
Games played on three-in-a-row boards can be traced back to ancient Egypt, where such game boards have been found on roofing tiles dating from around 1300 BC.
An early variation of tic-tac-toe was played in the Roman Empire, around the first century BC. It was called terni lapilli (three pebbles at a time) and instead of having any number of pieces, each player had only three; thus, they had to move them around to empty spaces to keep playing.

title: MEMORY GAME
description: Test your memory and have fun! Flip the cards and find the matching pairs in this classic concentration game.
instruction:
Objective: The objective of the game is to match all pairs of cards in the least number of moves.
Gameplay:
Click on two cards to reveal their image.
If the images on the two cards match, they remain face-up.
If the images do not match, both cards are flipped face-down again.
Continue selecting pairs of cards until all pairs are matched.
Scoring:
The game tracks the number of moves you make.
Try to match all pairs in the fewest moves possible to achieve a high score.
Winning:
The game is won when all pairs of cards are matched.
